title: Olivia Jade wears mental health top after Lori Laughlin 'tried to contact Felicity Huffman'
text:
YouTube star Olivia Jade, who found herself at the center of this year's college admissions scandal, was spotted in Beverly Hills on Thursday.

The 20-year-old modeled a hoodie covered in phrases like: 'Mental Capacity' and 'It's okay not to be okay' while out with her sister Isabella Rose Gianulli, 21.

It emerged in March that their parents Lori Loughlin and Mossimo Giannulli allegedly bribed the girls' way into University Of Southern California.

Out and about: YouTube star Olivia Jade, who found herself at the center of this year's college admissions scandal, was spotted in Beverly Hills on Thursday

Full House star Lori and Desperate Housewives icon Felicity Huffman were the two biggest names to be caught up in the scandal.

Felicity pleaded guilty to paying a $15,000 bribe and as of this Friday was on the fourth day of her 14-day jail sentence.

Lori tried to contact Felicity before she entered jail 'to encourage her, and see how she was doing,' according to a People insider.

'She feels like their fates are tied together now, even though they weren’t really friends before,' the source explained.

Family time: The 20-year-old modeled a hoodie covered in phrases like: 'Mental Capacity' and 'It's okay not to be okay' while out with her sister Isabella Rose Gianulli, 21

The former Hallmark star would also apparently like to speak to Felicity after her release on the off chance that she, Lori, has to serve time as well.

'She wants to debrief Felicity after jail to find out what it was like and what her advice would be. She feels like Felicity’s time in jail will be an indicator on her own time, and she’s extremely curious to know how it goes,' said the People source.

'She’s definitely hoping that Felicity’s time in prison will go easy for her, because that will be a positive sign that, if Lori has to serve time, that she’ll be able to weather it as well,' the insider gossiped of Lori.

'Of course, it’s still very important for her to be exonerated of all charges against her. She still maintains her innocence, and hopes it won’t come to that. But if she does end up serving time in prison, she wants to know what she’s getting into.'

Embattled: It emerged in March that their parents Lori Loughlin and Mossimo Giannulli allegedly bribed the girls' way into University Of Southern California

Lori and her fashion designer husband apparently paid $500,000 to falsely pass the girls off as potential college rowers on USC's team.

Olivia was holidaying on the yacht of the USC trustee board's billionaire chairman Rick Caruso the day her parents were indicted.

She was apparently on the vessel with Rick's daughter Gigi, who is her age and also a freshman at USC, according to The Hollywood Reporter.

Lori and Mossimo each got out on $1 million bail and have pleaded not guilty to all the charges brought against them, including money laundering.
